name: QueryData
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData
description:
QueryData

Represents Data returned from a query a a list of name/value pairs.

methods.name: total_bytes
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#total_bytes
methods.description: The total number of bytes processed for this query.

methods.name: complete?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#complete?
methods.description: Whether the query has completed or not. When data is present this will always be true. When false, total will not be available.

methods.name: cache_hit?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#cache_hit?
methods.description: Whether the query result was fetched from the query cache.

methods.name: headers
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#headers
methods.description: The name of the columns in the data.

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of query data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
job = bigquery.job "my_job"

data = job.query_results
if data.next?
  next_data = data.next
end

methods.name: next
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#next
methods.description: Retrieve the next page of query data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
job = bigquery.job "my_job"

data = job.query_results
if data.next?
  next_data = data.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all rows by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each row, which is passed as the parameter.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all rows are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each row by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
job = bigquery.job "my_job"

data = job.query_results
data.all do |row|
  puts row[:word]
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
job = bigquery.job "my_job"

data = job.query_results
words = data.all.map do |row|
  row[:word]
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
job = bigquery.job "my_job"

data = job.query_results
data.all(request_limit: 10) do |row|
  puts row[:word]
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to make
to load all data. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each row of data.

methods.name: job
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryData#job
methods.description: The BigQuery Job that was created to run the query.
